intro: Spilanthes phaneractis, commonly known as the showy cress, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like mustard and cabbage. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are hairy and somewhat branched. Spilanthes phaneractis is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, thriving in full sun.
